intro: Ligusticum angelicoides, commonly known as angelica root, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, valued in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and digestive benefits. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
